intro: Lisianthius trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with three distinct veins. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it blooms from late spring to early fall. Lisianthius trinervis is often found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woodlands.
